posts.title: Residential Community For Neurodiverse Adults Underway In Fayetteville
posts.content:
Supporting Lifelong Success, or SLS, will be Arkansas’s first nonprofit residential community for neurodiverse adults. 

  • One of a kind: The state of the art SLS facility will feature housing, clinics, work opportunities, and spaces for recreation on a property adjacent to Kessler Mountain Park in southwest Fayetteville. 
  • All belong: SLS Community is grounded in the mission of making essential resources accessible to neurodiverse adults and their families, 

Listen to KUAF interview with SLS executive director Ashton McCombs IV HERE.

posts.title: Casa Alejo Hosts Grand Opening Today In Downtown Springdale
posts.content:
Today is opening day for Casa Alejo, a delicious new Mexican restaurant at 101 W Emma Ave in Downtown Springdale. 

  • Ok so: The queso will knock your socks off, and it’s even better if you add chorizo. Order anything with campechana, a blend of steak and chorizo, and you won’t be disappointed. We also loved the quesabirria and couldn't stop eyeing the waffle fry nachos at the table next to us.
  • Lunch: Casa Alejo will be open Mon-Fri 11a-3p for lunch only, but plans to extend hours and open their bar by January. 

Follow Casa Alejo for updates HERE.

posts.title: Cool Jobs in NWA
posts.content:
Looking for a job? Check out these positions posted to our community board:

  • Lifewater International has a position open for a Director of Marketing*
  • Northwest Health is hiring for a Patient Navigator role.

Have a job you're looking to fill? Post it here!

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
Welcome to the weekend! Here are some ideas to make it a fun one: 

  • Polar lights: From north to south, NWA will get a little brighter this weekend with the start of Lights of the Ozarks at the Fayetteville Square tonight at 6p and the Lighting of the Square in Bentonville Saturday at 6p. 
  • Goals: Razorbacks Soccer hosts Ohio State for the second round of the NCAA Tournament tonight at 6:30p. 
  • Shop til you drop: Explore fabulous merchants during the NWA Boutique Show at the Rogers Convention Center today from 11a-4:30p and 9a-6p tomorrow. Don’t forget the fun Girls Night Out tonight! 
  • Cyclocross: Join ALL Cross CX at the Railyard in Rogers this Saturday, Nov 19 for cyclocross races that everyone can join. Register HERE. 
  • Mixer: Enjoy a locally curated art exhibit at the grand opening of MIXD Gallery in Rogers this Saturday, Nov 19 from 12-4p. 
  • Thanks: TheatreSquared is hosting a staged reading of Larissa Fasthorse’s show, “The Thanksgiving Play” this Sunday, Nov 20 at 5p. 

Stay warm out there! We’ll see you Monday.

posts.title: J.B. Hunt Aims To Dramatically Reduce Carbon Emissions
posts.content:
As part of its vision for sustainability, J.B. Hunt Transport Services plans to reduce its carbon emission intensity 32% by 2034

  • A better future: As one of America’s largest supply chain providers, this ambitious goal could pave the way for the freight industry towards a low-carbon future. 
  • Objectives: The company will pursue this goal by incorporating alternative powered equipment into its fleet, expanding the use of biogenic fuels, and improving fuel economy, 

Read more about J.B. Hunt’s plans HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Take flight: Apply now to join the 2023-24 academic year at Thaden School, the #1 Private School in Arkansas.*
  • It's PINK FRIDAY! Kick off the holiday shopping season and #supportsmallfirst. Support local with Line Dry Boutique's site wide sale here and check out the Pink Friday map of boutiques involved country wide!*
  • Number one: Trevon Brazile earned the #1 spot on SportsCenter’s Top 10, a shout out from Lebron, and Magic Johnson’s vote for “dunk of the year” after absolutely burying a dunk on South Dakota State. 
  • Fantastic: Jessica Alba spent a day in Bentonville touring Walmart HQ and highlighting various in-store products. 
  • Storytime: Have a story? We have room in the newsletter for you! Check out our deals HERE.

*Content is sponsored
